arm_group.description: The Foley Airway Stylet Tool was used to guide ProSeal LMA insertion
the ProSeal LMA was inserted with a standard introducer-tool

brief_summary.textblock:
Due to its soft cuff easily folded to impede ProSeal LMA insertion, many tools are
      developed. The aim of the study is to investigate the efficiency of ProSeal LMA insertion
      guided by a soft, direct optical Foley airway stylet tool (FAST) and compared with the
      standard introducer-tool (I-Tool).

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Foley Airway Stylet Tool on Proseal LMA Insertion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-II

          2. aged 20-65 years

          3. requiring LMA Intubation under general anesthesia

          4. unlimited mouth open

          5. unlimited neck motion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. mouth open ＜ 3 cm

          2. limited neck motion

          3. BMI≧35 kg/m2

clinical_study.keyword: LMA, Foley Airway Stylet Tool (FAST), introducer-tool (I-Tool)

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: The Efficiency of ProSeal Laryngeal Mask Airway Insertion: Compared the Techniques of Foley Airway Stylet Tool With Introducer-Tool

overall_official.affiliation: Department of anesthesiology, Kaohsiung Medical University, Taiwan

primary_outcome.description: successful airway establishment is defined as adequate ventilation with ProSeal LMA and its alignment with viewing of proper glottic and esophageal positions.
primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with successful airway establishment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: sore throat recorded in recovery room and in the coming morning
severity of hoarseness was recorded in recovery room and in the coming morning

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
